front.title: Deploying and Using Email in Deep Space

abstract.t: This document lists operational methods to deploy and use email in deep space.

section.name: Introduction
section.t: Deep space communications involve long delays (e.g. Earth to Mars is 4-22 minutes) and intermittent communications, because of orbital dynamics.
IP packet storage by forwarders facing intermittent links. So packets may take a long time to arrive at destination, such as minutes, hours, days, weeks.
Internets on celestial bodies; interconnected (if not, trafic goes back to Earth). deep space links

section.name: Deployment Scenario
section.t: SMTP gateway from Internet, act as a MTA, then uses JMAP for next hop to the other gateway on the celestial body.
flow diagram with internet, gateway, deepspace orbiter, gateway on Moon/Mars, internet on Moon/Mars

section.name: DNS Considerations
section.t: assumes a local DNS server cached with useful records on the celestial body network
headers such as Received and others should not be looked up as those

section.name: Unwanted Email Considerations
section.t: lookup from space for databases on Earth is not recommended.
methods using data in headers that need to be looked up on (Earth) Internet should not be done in space
to minimize use of deep space bandwidth which is scarce, strong anti-spamming should be done before leaving Earth.
